reviewText: I know I'm echoing a few other reviews but I have to say it. This is to my mind quite clearly the best documentary on the topic that I've ever seen... and I honestly don't know of any that I haven't watched at least once, much less own.I've watched Evidence of Revision in its entirety three times and it never ceases to amaze me, sadden me, disgust me... and frighten me (it has an odd, indescribable "Twilight Zone" feel to it.) And the three friends I've bought copies for have reacted the same way... all of us armchair students of the JFK and RFK assassinations.To those JFK researchers who think they've seen all the footage of Oswald in the Dallas jail... well, you haven't...And let me say something which will sound a bit extreme, but from my heart...I would literally question the cognitive abilities, the intellectual capabilities of any person of average intelligence who would watch this entire DVD set and come out of it believing that their government had not been involved in these assassinations. I would question their sanity. I really would.
summary: Simply the Best Documentary on the Subject(s)

reviewText: Highly recommend!Edited: Most strongly recommend to ID SCAD. jmdI finished watching this last night. I very carefully note that this stuff is not just something to blow through in a few days where as I am keenly aware of what self-preservation really means.There's no two ways about it where as I find it profoundly difficult (and quite frankly, an insult to any thinking adult) not to recognize that there are elements within the United States government that specifically murdered and covered up this crime in killing some of the greatest leaders in American history after watching this powerfully emotional material.The whole work presents the large picture that there was and still is a cover-up of the facts, using historical film footage of the events, including interviews of the people that were there and recorded news reports that weave a astonishing picture.  In a crude way, I sort of equate this to the Allegory of the Cave, after he broke free and then only recognized how he had been deceived.Specifically, I came across this production because of my falling down the rabbit hole in regards to the tragic events that the world saw on September 11th, 2001, my quest to understand the strange and almost impossible "official" anomalies as claimed by the Government, and my society's lack of mature response to the clear deceptions and truth about 9/11. This includes my inability to process the "facts" as presented by the United States Government and the "official approval" by Mass Media on countless events throughout our history that not only include the United States, but is worldwide. reviewText: I am a conspiracy buff and I collect DVDs of the Kennedy assassination.  This DVD ranks up there among the best.  The images, editing and music are sobering, haunting and thought provoking.  There is no narration to spoon feed information.  I believe the reason for this is to make you think for yourself, which it really made me do.  There is a lot of unseen footage I've never seen before and I learned a lot.  Highly recommended.

reviewText: I've read and I'm reading a number of books (currently reading `JFK and the Unspeakable' and `An Act of State: The Execution of Martin Luther King') and articles on the JFK, RFK and King assassinations as well as other topics mentioned in this documentary.  There seems to be no substitute for watching live footage and allowing it to speak for itself to really drive the home the nature of what happened some 40-50 years ago.  I think it is essential to buy this and watch for yourself what happened.  We lost so much then and until we start to acknowledge and act on what `Evidence of Revision' and other sources show we will continue to be ruled and corralled by the very same insidious forces that where behind the assassinations.

reviewText: EVIDENCE OF REVISION - The Assassination of AmericaThis documentary is essential viewing for anyone with an interest in the assassination of President John F. Kennedy on 22 November 1963.Presented by: Conspiratus Ubiquitus  Producer: ETYMON ProductionsA 3-Disc set in a single case. Color and black & white.Total running time - About 10.5 hours.Unfortunately, there are no subtitles. Some of the audio is of poor quality, and subtitles would be of great benefit here.From the back cover: Evidence of revision is a six part documentary containing historical, original news footage revealing that the most seminal events in recent American history have been deeply and purposefully misrepresented to the public. Footage and interviews provide an in-depth exploration of events ranging from the Kennedy assassinations to the Jonestown massacre, and all that lies between. The footprints left in this archival footage reveal the coordinated, clandestine sculpting of the America we know today. Evidence of revision proves once and for all that history has been revised even as it was written!The following message appears at the beginning of the program: This documentary series contains many historical video documents that have, in essence, been controlled. Documents which define history should belong to the public, not private interests.Disc 1Part 1 : The assassinations of Kennedy and Oswald (Run Time - 128 mins)Part 2 :  The why of it all referenced to Vietnam and LBJ (Run Time - 90 mins)Disc 2Part 3 : LBJ, Hoover, and Others : What so few know even today (Run Time - 93 mins)Part 4 : The RFK assassination as never seen before (Run Time - 108 mins)Disc 3Part 5 : RFK assassination, MKUltra, and the Jonestown Massacre (R/T - 109 mins)Part 6 : The assassination of Martin Luther King (Run Time - 122 Minutes)The following persons feature predominantly in this production:John Fitzgerald Kennedy (1917-1963) - The 35th President of the United States 1961-63Robert Francis Kennedy (1925-1968) - U.S. Attorney General 1961-64John Will Fritz - Chief of Homicide and Robbery, Dallas PoliceJesse Curry (1913-1980)- Chief of the Dallas Police DepartmentHenry Wade (1914-2001) - Dallas District AttorneyEarle Cabell (1906-1975) - Mayor of DallasLee Oswald (1939-1963) - Accused of the assassination of JFK, assassinated by Jack RubyJack Ruby/Rubenstein (1911-1967) - Charged with the assassination of Lee OswaldTom Howard - Attorney for Jack RubyRoger Craig (?-1975) - Dallas County Deputy SheriffSTATEMENTI would like to apologize for the length of the review, although I have only reviewed the first 3 parts! However, there is so much presented within this documentary - in the form of eyewitness testimony, statements by prominent persons, background information, and evidence - that I consider it vitally important for readers of my review to learn what the documentary contains and hopefully be motivated to get hold of a copy for themselves.EVIDENCE OF REVISION - The assassination of AmericaPart1 - The assassinations of Kennedy and Oswald (128 Minutes)- Learn that Aldous Huxley, author of Brave New World, died only a few hours after the assassination, and that evangelist Billy Graham had a premonition that President Kennedy should not go to Texas, and tried to persuade him not to go.- Hear Reporter Ed Hubert state that "the President has broken one of the cardinal rules of security - in fact he broke it 2 or 3 times - he went out into the crowd" and "once he moves into a crowd, the secret service men are nearly immobilized in protecting him." He goes on "On September 6, 1901, those two rules were broken and it ended in tragedy, that was the day that President McKinley [was assassinated] by a man who said he was an anarchist with a long history of mental illness". The program suggests that this, in effect, is conditioning the public to what is about to come.- See a photograph that appears to indicate a policeman in the grassy knoll area firing a weapon at the moment of the assassination. See a video showing streams of bystanders running up to behind the grassy knoll just after the murder- Hear a newscaster state: "Dallas motorcycle officers who were ranging along beside the cavalcade took off across the field in the direction from which the murderer apparently had fired; one officer raced to the foot of the nearby railroad embankment and climbed to the tracks above gun in hand."- Hear an eyewitness state she saw two men in the Texas School Book Depository window, one in a kneeling position with a gun pointed down, and another man standing beside him ("I thought they were guards"). "I heard one shot, and I thought at the time that the first shot was a firecracker, anyway two more shots, and then seconds later one more."- Hear Roger Craig, Deputy Sheriff, describe what he saw, and stating his "interest was to get up to the grassy knoll." Craig describes how they searched the 6th floor of the depository building and found 3 spent cartridges ("neatly arranged") and a rifle. "Stamped right on the barrel of the rifle was 7.65 Mauser. The shells we found came from a 6.5 Italian rifle. The two don't relate."- Later Roger Craig states " One 45 slug was found on the South side of Elm Street, outside on the grass". See a newspaper clipping showing a photograph of this bullet! See photographs of an agent pocketing the bullet! Hear two witnesses state that they saw that a manhole cover there had been damaged by this bullet.- See video footage of two officers examining the rifle found in the book depository with what appears to be another rifle nearby directly in view!- See the affidavit signed by Deputy Constable Seymour Weitzman stating that the rifle found was a 7.65 Mauser. See multiple news reports mentioning a German-made 7.65 Mauser. Hear the rifle identified change from a Mauser to an Italian Mannlicher-Carcano!- Hear multiple witnesses say that at about the time of the fatal bullet they thought the Presidential car had come to an almost complete stop. See Walter Cronkite state how "a gap had opened up in the motorcade just before the assassin's bullet rang out" which "saved Vice President Johnson"!- Describing why the plastic bubble top was not put on the President's Limousine, a reporter states: "The reason why, is the personality of the late President of the United States John Kennedy who never, ever, heeded the warnings of the secret service men against going in to crowds, never ever obeyed their wishes ..."- Hear about a letter that Lee Oswald wrote in 1961 to the then Secretary of the Navy, John Connelly.- In reference to the assassination, see former president Dwight D. Eisenhower say "The American nation is a people of great common sense, and they are not going to be stampeded or bewildered!"- See a newsreader say "The mechanics of the takeover are already in operation."- Listen to Walter Cronkite as he reads the Kremlin's official position on the assassination: "Those who know how the security of President Kennedy is organized know that it is not possible for a fanatic to commit such an assassination. A political crime, thoroughly prepared and planned, has taken place. The President's slaying was inspired by forces opposed to President Kennedy's policy of improving relations with the Soviet Union."- See Jim Hagerty (former Press Secretary for President Eisenhower and then Vice President of ABC Paramount Pictures) state in an interview: "I think this has to be a planned conspiracy...a very carefully planned terrible tragedy and conspiracy."- Hear former Major General Edwin Walker (himself the victim of an attempted assassination a few months earlier) say: "The death of Mr. Kennedy is not as surprising as it is tragic. The tragic events of yesterday demonstrate the internal threat that can never be underestimated."- Hear the following exchange - Reporter: "Did you shoot the President?" Oswald: "I didn't shoot anybody no Sir!". See video of Lee Harvey Oswald in custody. See the press gathered in a room to interview Oswald - Jack Ruby is clearly visible!- See the surprised reaction of Oswald when advised by a reporter that he has indeed been charged with the murder of the President. Oswald states the Police have not even accused him of this as yet!- See the following exchange - Reporter: "Let's make it clear we have all agreed with the Chief that we will not ask Oswald any questions". Chief: "The more you upset him the more difficult it is for us to cope!"- Hear John Connelly recall that he said "My God, they're going to kill us all!"- Learn that JFK fired Allen Dulles (long time Director of the CIA), and General Cabelle, his deputy. Learn that General Cabelle was the brother of the Mayor of Dallas at the time of the assassination!- Learn that at the time of his firing, General Cabelle was told by Kennedy "If this were England, I'd have to go. But this is America, and you have to go!"- Hear the Mayor of Dallas Earl Cabelle state just after the assassination: "This can only be the act of a deranged mind!" and that "There is no question whatsoever in my mind that every possible security precaution was taken". Learn that Captain Will Fritz was in charge of the investigation, together with the FBI, the CIA, and the Dallas Police Department.- Hear Fritz describe Oswald as being "Very co-operative" adding that Oswald had "admitted nothing yet", then goes on to say that "without going into the evidence, this case is cinched!"- Learn that Mr. Oswald was killed just one hour before he was due to appear at his first full press conference.- See Oswald get shot. A reporter states "The man who saw the shot fired said it was fired by a man wearing a black hat and a brown coat, a man that everyone down here thought was a secret-service agent!"- See the reaction of Captain Fritz, who hardly reacts to the sound of Ruby shooting Oswald; in fact he calmly stands there doing nothing and arguably shields the way forward to prevent intervention in the shooting and of help reaching Oswald quickly.- Note that Ruby reacts at the very moment the car horn sounds, as if signalled! Hear that an ambulance had been standing by, "in case of an emergency"!- Hear a reporter state: "Early this morning, according to a Dallas Police Officer, they received the following call: I don't want any problems, I don't want any Policemen to get hurt, but there's one group that's going to get that man when he is transferred."- Hear WFAA TV News Director Bob Walker say "...just learned from City Hall from a very authoritative source that Police are working on the assumption that there indeed is a connection between Jack Ruby and Lee Oswald, and that in some manner of speaking Oswald's murder was to shut-him-up; also they have said they will not release, in the immediate future, at all, any information the FBI has gathered which led them to believe so strongly that Oswald had assassinated the President."- Hear a reporter say " What happened here today was impossible, according to Police".- See Tom Howard (Attorney for Jack Ruby) deny to reporters that there is any type of connection between Jack Ruby and Oswald. When a reporter states "A performer says he saw Oswald at Ruby's Carousel Club" Howard says "I think he is mistaken". When informed that the witness performs as a memory expert, Howard says "he claims to be"!- See footage of Jack Ruby lingering in the halls with reporters at Police Headquarters.- See reporters discussing Jack Ruby with District Attorney Henry Wade. A reporter says: "He seemed to me like a detective, he seemed to be all over this place" adding [to Henry Wade] "Looked to me like he was a good friend [of yours]".- See Jack Ruby say: "a conspiracy... if you knew the true facts you'd be amazed at it."- See Jack Ruby say: "Everything pertaining to what's happening has never come to the surface... the world will never know the true facts of what occurred, my motives. In other words, I'm the only person in the background that knows the truth pertaining to everything relating to my circumstances".- See Jack Ruby say: "The people who have so much to gain and who had such an ulterior motive for putting me in the position I'm in, will never let the true facts come above board to the world."- Learn that in 1947 Jack Ruby testified before the House Un-American Activities Committee as an informant for the FBI and was on the staff of Republican congressman Richard M. Nixon!!- See Jack Ruby say: "If Adlai Stevenson was Vice President there would never have been an assassination of our beloved president Kennedy. The answer is the man in office now [Lyndon B. Johnson]."- Hear Roger Craig (Deputy Sheriff) state that he was told by the Sheriff of Dallas that:  "You didn't see anything and you didn't hear anything". After being fired from his job, Craig says he was followed and was himself the victim of 3 assassination attempts.- Learn that Roger Craig died in Dallas May 15, 1975, of a rifle wound to the chest. He himself owned two pistols. The Coroner's verdict was suicide!- Learn that Deputy Sheriff Eddie Buddy Walters, the agent who pocketed the 45 slug in Dealey Plaza, was shot to death in 1969 in mysterious circumstances.- See multiple reporters say that a bullet struck Kennedy in the front of the neck (Dan Rather CBS News, Frank Magee NBC News, Robert Pierpoint CBS News)EVIDENCE OF REVISION - The assassination of AmericaPart 2:  The why of it all referenced to Vietnam and LBJ (90 mins)- "Texas was home to Kennedy's most dangerous opponents. Oil millionaires and billionaires in Texas were petrified of one major factor that John F. Kennedy was considering - cutting the oil depletion allowance - and there was no way they were going to allow that. Essentially, they would save billions of dollars if it stays the way it is" - The Narrator- See Kennedy talk about peace. See some excerpts from Kennedy speeches.- Learn about the background to the Vietnam War, beginning in 1954. See Richard Nixon warn of the domino effect of communist aggression. Learn that Nixon was one of the first to favour military intervention, and supported the use of tactical nuclear weapons.- Learn that JFK's Vietnam policy was to pull out, and National Security Memorandum No.263 was signed in October 1963 stating this. Learn that a mere 4 days after JFK's assassination, Lyndon Johnson issued a new National Security Action Memorandum No. 273 which began a modest change, then in March of 1964 another memorandum No.288 began the attacks on North Vietnam.- See President Eisenhower, in his farewell address, state: "In the councils of government, we must guard against the acquisition of unwarranted influence, whether sought or unsought, by the military-industrial complex".- Hear Major John M. Newman say: "I don't think there's any doubt that JFK was pulling out of Vietnam when he was killed, and because the most fundamental tenet of his policy was `no combat troops'; and we know that Johnson put in combat troops, it's safe to say that the assassination led directly to the escalation of the [Vietnam] war."- Hear Retired Colonel Fletcher Prouty, former Chief of Special Operations working for the joint chiefs of staff state, regarding JFK's policy: "The way that struck people who were leaning toward the profits and the benefits of a Vietnam war, was really unimaginable.... so a power elite coalesces - they don't have to vote - and among them they say `You know - that guy's gotta go'"- Learn about DESOTO patrols operating in the Gulf of Tonkin off the North Vietnamese coast, and essentially designed to provoke North Vietnam. This led to the Gulf of Tonkin incident, during the first year of the Johnson administration.- Hear Senator Wayne Morse say in 1964: "The sad fact is history will record that the United States was an aggressor in Tonkin Bay - we were violating the rights of North Vietnam and had no right to proceed on the second day to ourselves bomb North Vietnam, ... that wasn't defense and bombing North Vietnam was not within the right of the President [Johnson] to act in self defense of the Republic. I'm contending that having the Maddox and the [Turner] Joy there constituted... an act of aggression on our part."- See Lyndon Johnson say: "Every day someone jumps up and shouts and says "Tell us what is happening in Vietnam and why are we in Vietnam and how did you get us into Vietnam ... but I didn't get you into Vietnam. You've been in Vietnam ten years!" and "It is the melancholy law of human societies to be compelled sometimes to choose a great evil in order to ward off a greater evil".- Learn about Lyndon Baines Johnson, where he grew up and his entry into politics in 1937. Learn how Johnson scraped into the Senate in the 1948 election thanks to the discovery of 202 additional votes reported from Precinct Box 13 six days after the polls had closed. "That rigged ballot became the template for a political career based on bribery and corruption" - The Narrator- Learn that Billie Sol Estes, a former Johnson business associate, appeared before a Grand Jury in 1984 and testified that 8 murders had been perpetrated on the direct orders of Lyndon Johnson. Learn that one of the names on Estes list was Joseta Johnson - so Estes was accusing Johnson of murdering his own sister! Learn that the eighth name on Estes list was the President of the United States John F. Kennedy. "If Billie Sol Estes is telling the truth, and there is every reason to believe he is, it gives you an idea of the depth of the corruption and the ruthlessness of Lyndon Johnson"- Learn about the murder of John Douglas Kinser by Malcolm Wallace in 1951 in Austin, Texas. Wallace, a Johnson henchman, was found guilty of first degree murder, but through the influence of Lyndon Johnson received a 5 year suspended sentence!-  Hear the claim by a lawyer who worked with Johnson's lawyer Edward Clark, that Clark was the one who arranged the assassination of Kennedy: "I know beyond a reasonable doubt that Johnson murdered Kennedy. He acted through Clark, he saw that it was done and he did it out of a corruption of power that is unequalled in our history."- Learn about the murder of Henry Marshall on order of Vice President Johnson in 1961. In spite of his being shot 5 times the death was ruled a suicide.- See the article written by prominent journalist Arthur Krock in the New York Times on 3 October 1963 describing a possible coup by the CIA against the Government.- Learn of Lee Harvey Oswald's links to the CIA and FBI. Hear about George de Mohrenschildt, a CIA operative who had befriended Oswald. His death in 1977 was ruled a suicide despite evidence that he was murdered. See documents indicating that Lee Harvey Oswald "was directly involved in sensitive intelligence operations for the CIA and probably the FBI as well".EVIDENCE OF REVISION - The assassination of AmericaPart 3: LBJ, Hoover, and Others : What so few know even today (93 mins)- Learn that on the same day that Kennedy was arriving in Dallas, a Maryland insurance agent named Don Reynolds arrived on Capital Hill to brief republican staff members of the rules committee. He promised proof that Vice President Johnson had mis-used his office for personal gain. Reynolds showed the investigators invoices, documents and diary entries he claimed implicated the Vice President. This investigation stalled because of the assassination of Kennedy.- Learn that D.H. Byrd, a wealthy Texan with close ties to Johnson, owned the Texas School Book Depository Building; he also founded the Civil Air Patrol. Lee Harvey Oswald was a member of the Civil Air Patrol.- Learn about Clint Murchison, an oil millionaire who owned the Hotel Del Charro in California, which he used to influence politicians including Johnson, J. Edgar Hoover, and Richard Nixon. Learn that Bobby Baker, Senate Majority Secretary 1955-1963, and political advisor to LBJ, was involved in business deals with Murchison, many of them illegal. Hear Baker say that Murchison told him he owned a piece of Hoover and learn the reason why.- Learn that J. Edgar Hoover (Director of the FBI 1935-1972  remained a bachelor his entire life and spent a great deal of time with Clyde Tolson, his heir when he died. Hear that Meyer Lansky, organized crime figure, had obtained photographs of Hoover in a "compromising situation" engaged in homosexual activity. Hear Gordon Novel, CIA operative, says he saw similar photographs at a meeting with James Angleton, CIA Director of Counter-Intelligence.- Hear that the Mafia used the information they had on Hoover to "keep the FBI off their backs". Learn that in the 40's the FBI hardly touched organized crime because "Hoover denied that syndicated organized crime existed and ignored all evidence that it did".- Learn that before the Kennedy's, the mob had been "literally getting away with murder. They owned politicians; they owned unions - and the FBI said they didn't exist".- Learn that the day after he was elected President, John Kennedy re-appointed J. Edgar Hoover as director of the FBI. Hoovers immediate boss would be Robert Kennedy, an Attorney General "determined to crack down on organized crime".- Learn that Robert Kennedy forced FBI Director J. Edgar Hoover to "shift manpower and resources away from hunting communists, to busting gangsters." Under Robert Kennedy successful prosecutions of organized crime figures increased 700%.- Learn that by 1963 "Hoover was becoming isolated and entrenched within the FBI that he had created, then, just after lunchtime on November 22, Hoover called his boss Bobby Kennedy to tell him that his brother, the President, had been shot in Dallas." Hear Nicholas Katzernbach, U.S. Attorney general during the Johnson administration, describe that Bobby Kennedy had said to him "I think Hoover enjoyed telling me."- In a recorded interview, hear Bobby Kennedy describe Hoover as "dangerous". Learn that Hoover's modus operandi was to use blackmail to control his enemies.- Hear Walter Mondale, Vice President 1976-1980 say, "One of the reasons Hoover stayed on years after the Civil Service rules said he should retire is that, I think, a lot of Presidents were afraid to drop the hammer on him."- Learn that when John Kennedy won the Democratic Nomination in 1960, "he surprised almost everyone by asking Lyndon Johnson to be Vice President", and that the Kennedy brothers made this decision in secret, and vowed never to tell what happened.- Learn that Evelyn Lincoln, Kennedy's Secretary, was at the Biltmore Hotel when the decision to run with Johnson on the ticket was made: "[They were] trying to figure out how they could maneuver to get it so [Johnson] wouldn't be on the ticket", adding that what she heard that day "convinced her the Kennedy's were being blackmailed".- Hear Evelyn Lincoln state: " One of the factors that made John F. Kennedy choose Lyndon B. Johnson for Vice President were the malicious rumors that were fed to Lyndon B. Johnson by J. Edgar Hoover about his womanizing.... Lyndon B. Johnson and J. Edgar Hoover had boxed them into a hole - they were absolutely boxed in."- Hear the following telephone conversation between Johnson and Hoover recorded 29 November 1963: "You're more than the head of the federal Bureau as far as I'm concerned. You're my brother and personal friend and have been for 25...30 years".- Learn that Lyndon Johnson detested playing "second fiddle" to the younger Jack Kennedy: "This young pup Jack Kennedy suddenly is it, and he Lyndon Johnson, big `ol clumsy Lyndon Johnson is playing second fiddle, and you gotta believe it that those Vice Presidential years were agony for him."...."It wasn't the way the President treated him, I think Jack Kennedy treated him with due respect, but everybody around Kennedy kind-of poked fun at him and make mockery of whatever-happened-to-Lyndon-Johnson."- As Bobby Baker describes it: "Kennedy named [Johnson] head of the space centre plus he sent him on every foreign trip in the history of the world to - you know - try to give him something to do!" Learn that Vice President Johnson made ceremonial visits to 26 countries.- Learn that Lyndon Johnson was in big trouble due to the Bobby Baker scandal and the Billy Sol Estes scandal, which could "destroy Lyndon Johnson's career". Lyndon Johnson would go to jail, and he represented all the right-wing forces. There was an urgency to Kill President Kennedy. "The Governor of Texas is Lyndon Johnson's best friend in history - they went back decades together. In the 1948 vote scandal John Connelly was very much a part of that cover-up that took place - he was Johnson's campaign manager. It is without question John Connelly who entices John F. Kennedy to Texas. Once they get him there then they're in control of everything - motorcade routes, the evidence, the Dallas Police, everything. It's their land - it's their territory. Lyndon Johnson and his Texas cronies suckered President Kennedy into Texas."- Learn that Lyndon Johnson was himself a great womanizer, and according to Robert Dallek, his Biographer: "When they'd tell him about Kennedy's womanizing he would bang the table and say `Damn it to hell I had more women by accident than he ever had on purpose!'" Hear Robert Dallek state that Johnson "once had sex with one of his secretaries on a table in the White House."- Hear Madeleine Brown describe her life-long affair with LBJ which lasted for 21 years and which she claims produced a son, Steven Mark Brown (1950-1990). Learn that in 1987 Steven Brown filed a 10.5 million-dollar lawsuit against Lady Bird Johnson, claiming that he had been deprived of his birthright. Before the suit could be tried Steven Brown died of Lymphatic cancer.- See a letter addressed to Madeleine Brown dated 18 May 1973 (just four months after Johnson's death), stating: "As discussed in Houston, you have my personal assurance that I will continue with the financial arrangements that Lyndon provided for you and Steve throughout the past." The letter is from Jerome T. Ragsdale, Johnson's attorney.- Hear Madeleine Brown swear that President Lyndon Johnson said to her regarding Kennedy's assassination "It was the oil people he knew and the CIA" who were involved in the murder of John Kennedy.- Hear Madeleine Brown state that on the morning of the assassination Vice President Lyndon Johnson said to her that "After today, those blankety-blank Kennedy's would never embarrass him again. That's no threat, that's a promise."- Learn that the Warren Commission did not call Madeleine Brown as a witness, and that according to author Craig Zirbel: "The Warren Commission was a politically biased entity created by Lyndon Johnson for the sole purpose of getting him out of another political scandal."According to Zirbel, under the law in 1963 the killing of a President if caused by a lone assassin fell under State jurisdiction not Federal: "The Texans came out and said it was a lone killing therefore they had exclusive jurisdiction to investigate the case and prosecute."- Learn that Lyndon Johnson put the Warren Commission together and it included Allen Dulles who had previously been fired by Kennedy as director of the CIA.- Learn that on the night before Kennedy's assassination there was a party at the family home of Clint Merchison, oil billionaire. Those who attended included H.L. Hunt, Clint Merchison, Lyndon Johnson, J. Edgar Hoover, and Richard Nixon! Hear other witnesses confirm J. Edgar Hoover's presence there."The rich and powerful men who had met in secret the night before had everything to gain from [Kennedy's] death. LBJ was fearful of a long prison sentence, J. Edgar Hoover of losing his job, and the oilmen of losing millions of dollars. When the shots rang out on Elm Street the next day, those problems were solved." The Narrator- Hear Madeleine Brown state: "I would like the entire world to know how I personally feel is the fact Lyndon Johnson knew about the assassination and was part of it."- Hear a recording of the following exchange between Johnson and Hoover:LBJ: "I want to get by just with your file and your report"Hoover: "It would be very very bad to have a rash of investigations"LBJ: "Well, the only way we can stop `em is probably to appoint a high-level one to evaluate your report, and to put somebody that's pretty good on it, that I could select, and tell the House and Senate not to go ahead with the investigations".- Hear Robert Kennedy say about LBJ: "Our President was a gentleman and a human being - this man is not - he's mean, vicious, an animal in many ways. He's got this other side of him and his relationship with other human beings, which makes it very difficult unless you wanna kiss his be-hind all the time. He's able to eat people up."- Learn that after the Presidents murder all the physical evidence relating to the crime was swiftly removed to Washington.- Hear Dr. Charles Crenshaw state that President Johnson called during the time they were trying to save Oswald's life. Johnson said: "There is a man in the room - I would like for him to take a death-bed confession". Switchboard operator at Parkland Hospital Phyllis Bartlett confirms the call was made.- Learn that in the hours following the assassination a mysterious fingerprint was found in the sniper's nest of the 6th floor of the Texas School Book Depository Building. The fingerprint was only identified in 1998 as belonging to Malcolm Wallace, LBJ's henchman and the convicted killer of Dougas Kinser.- Learn that Malcolm Wallace died on the night of January 7, 1971 in a single-car accident on a stretch of Texas Highway - and there were no witnesses.- Hear Don Hewitt, executive producer of CBS Evening News in 1963, and creator of '60 Minutes' give his impressions and state: "[Johnson's people] thought, if the truth ever comes out here, we are ripe for a revolution!"- See Richard Nixon say: "This is the day that Johnson was going to get at his revenge. Johnson didn't particularly like Jack Kennedy - he hated Bobby Kennedy."- See Jim Garrison say: "If you just keep in mind who profited most from the assassination, and then ask yourself some questions. Who appointed the members of the Warren Commission? And who runs the CIA, which has concealed a tremendous amount of evidence? And who runs the FBI?"- See Jessie Curry, Chief of the Dallas Police Department in 1963, say: "I think there's a possibility that one [shot] could have come from in front of us. We've never been able to prove that, but just in my mind and by the direction of the blood and brain from the President from one of the shots it would just seem that it would have to be fired from the front rather than from behind."- Hear Senator Ralph Yardborough say: "Had Kennedy lived I think we'd have had no Vietnam war with all of its traumatic and divisive influences in America."- See Mikhail Gorbachev, Former Secretary, Communist Party of the Soviet Union, say: "The Warren Commission either was unable to learn the truth, and to complete the investigation, or they decided to conceal some of the truth, based on what they saw as the vital interest of the nation. Whatever has been written more recently about John F. Kennedy, about his personal life, and some of his personal weaknesses, I hold that he was a great President - he had great plans for the future, for the future of the United States and the world - that had great promise for the entire world. The world could have turned out quite differently if those plans were realized, and my question is: Was this really to the liking of some people in your country, and perhaps in our country and elsewhere? That's my question."
summary: Then you will know the truth, and the truth will set you free (John 8:32)
Title: N/A

reviewText: The first episode in this series is comprised of a collage of imagery. It seems as if on this episode the video compression is horrendous, or that some type of other image blurring is utilized in order to skirt copyright (?). Who knows. The image quality is abyssmal and annoying on episode 1.The rest of the series is absolutely not that way. Fascinating material on Lyndon B. Johnson, the statement of an officer at the scene of the Depository regarding the rifle recovered compared to the bullet casings found, and further sober analyses/presentations. Various environmental & situational realities of the MLK murder are also standout segments.People need to study history and come to grips with the reality of the world in which we live.
Title: N/A

reviewText: A very nice hodgepodge of documentary pieces addressing the 1960s assassinations of the Kennedys and Dr. King, meticulously interwoven to good effect.No objective person can watch this and still calmly assert that the "lone nut" scenario still holds --- in any of these three murders.That said, I have a problem with the very final moment of this 3-disc extravanganza when they flatly assert that 9/11 was a supposedly "staged" event... I realize I may in the minority on this, but I don't like it when legitimate conspiracy scenarios (like the killings of JFK, RFK and MLK) get muddied by "Truth Out/Inside Job" arguments, no matter how sincere and well-intentioned.Any valid government conspiracy in 9/11 seems to have been after-the-fact and very out in the open, as the Dubya White House lied by knowingly misrepresenting intelligence data to trick the public and the Congress into supporting a war on a country the White House was well-aware had nothing to do with the 9/11 attacks. And if 9/11 was pre-planned by our own government, then God knows Cheney and Rove would have been in on it --- and yet, given the scotch tape and spit arguments they threw together at the last minute to justify the invasion of Iraq, it seems pretty clear Dubya's men didn't anticipate it.I mean, I'm no defender of the Bushes, and I'm well aware of their stealing both the 2000 (and 2004 via Diebold!) elections, and their associations with the bin Ladens as well as the CIA's with the Taliban in the '80s. And yet I just don't think the evidence is there to show an in-house conspiracy in 9/11 prior to it occurring.Otherwise, "Evidence of Revision" is recommended.
summary: Very good potpourri of assassination documentaries
